issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.mercurynews.com/2024/03/03/blizzard-warning-extended-roads-impassable-as-tahoe-tries-to-dig-out/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mercurynews.com%2F2024%2F03%2F03%2Fblizzard-warning-extended-roads-impassable-as-tahoe-tries-to-dig-out%2F) ### Comment > Related to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/173637 > > The first article in a visit will now display correctly, but after returning to the site’s homepage and selecting another article the pop up will show up again. Quitting safari via the app switcher and reopening will allow the article to display correctly again, but with the same caveats: trying to read a different article will result in the pop up again. Username: `@contextnerror` ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/n70qv1kbtes0c4gccgcsc40scokkocwmcwetu1jf40.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.2 System version: | iOS 17.3.1 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

issue.title: open.spotify.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/playlist/2PPoNK5DbKT2Qu0Q9XX7Wq?si=Uy34Cj4HTAOcTde1VGyW8g&nd=1&dlsi=8a1623ea98c048a2&flow_ctx=3fc661f5-5cb1-4cad-9d1e-fc9d396a5c24%3A1709551112](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2Fplaylist%2F2PPoNK5DbKT2Qu0Q9XX7Wq%3Fsi%3DUy34Cj4HTAOcTde1VGyW8g%26nd%3D1%26dlsi%3D8a1623ea98c048a2%26flow_ctx%3D3fc661f5-5cb1-4cad-9d1e-fc9d396a5c24%253A1709551112) ### Comment > I can't show it via screenshots but the issue is songs play with no music at the beginning unless I fiddle with my Aèropods Pro, Screw around with my volume, pause and resume the website's controls AND screw with the volume control with Spotify. I can't stand Spotify and was simply looking to grab the playlist and migrate it to Apple Music. I thought it was a very interesting problem I'd never came across so thought to pass it along. One more interesting bit, same behaviour using laptop speakers, as well as a VM with a sound card adapter; it's definitely not unique to a specfic OS. Username: `@9f4KPA72Yqeztf8a` ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ivk4ay3wttwk80g4g880ss4o0cc8so8b9astkhzcig.png?nc=1) [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/4n5suigivuo0g8owgwcwg0g4kww04ggskft75fhpr4.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.13.0.1558 release System version: | MacOS Sonoma 14.3.1 Browser: | Safari License type: | paid Stealth mode options: | Block WebRTC,

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.
